etymologies: late Old English pellicane, via late Latin from Greek pelekan, probably based on pelekus ‘axe’ (with reference to its bill)

definitions: a large gregarious waterbird with a long bill, an extensible throat pouch for scooping up fish, and mainly white or gray plumage.

notes.text: Genus Pelecanus, family Pelecanidae: six species, including the white pelican (P. erythrorhynchos) of western and central North America, and the brown pelican (P. occidentalis) of northern and western South America and the southern US

shortDefinitions: large gregarious waterbird with long bill, extensible throat pouch for scooping up fish

definitions: a heraldic or artistic representation of a pelican, typically depicted pecking its own breast as a symbol of Christ.
shortDefinitions: heraldic or artistic representation of pelican
